title: How to Edit Existing Email Account Information on an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. The Settings icon is gray with gears on it and is found on your Home Screen.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . It's at the top of the fifth section of menu options.

steps.title: Tap Accounts at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Tap Accounts at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap on an account from the list to edit it.
steps.content: Tap on an account from the list to edit it.

steps.title: Tap Account.
steps.content: Tap Account . This will open the Account Information screen where you can make your changes. This cannot be done using your iCloud account.

steps.title: Tap Name to edit the account name.
steps.content: Tap Name to edit the account name.

steps.title: Tap Email to change the email address.
steps.content: Tap Email to change the email address.

steps.title: Tap Description to change it.
steps.content: Tap Description to change it. The Description can be anything, as it typically serves as a reminder for which email account it corresponds to.

steps.title: Tap SMPT to edit the outgoing mail server.
steps.content: Tap SMPT to edit the outgoing mail server. This is useful if you want to add another outgoing mail server to use as a failsafe in case your primary server isn't working.

steps.title: Tap Advanced to see more settings.
steps.content: Tap Advanced to see more settings. This window gives you options to change mailbox behaviors, what happens to your discarded messages, and other incoming mail settings.
